template.h3: Manage Sales and Payments in Point of Sale
template.p: Manage in-store transactions for skincare, makeup, or beauty tools with the Point of Sale app.

ol.li: Open the Point of Sale App and start a session by clicking on your register.

Add products to the cart by scanning barcodes or searching manually, and manage cosmetics with product variants (e.g. shade, size, scent) to offer customers personalized options and accurate stock tracking.
Proceed to payment by using the selected method: cash, card, or on the Customer Account if the client pays later.
Inventory levels update automatically after each sale.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Configure Optional Products: Suggest complementary items such as adding a body cream as an optional product to a scrub for a complete body care routine. These suggestions appear during checkout to encourage upselling.
Offer ‚Ç¨50 gift cards that can be purchased and redeemed on any product‚Äîideal for special occasions. Set this up in Gift Cards & eWallet.
Reward loyal customers with points by enabling a loyalty program in Discount & Loyalty. For example, give 1 point per ‚Ç¨1 spent and offer ‚Ç¨5 off at 100 points.
Link the Sale to a Customer: On the PoS screen, select a customer before finalizing the sale. This ensures any loyalty program or customer-specific rewards are correctly applied and tracked.

template.p: Sell cosmetics and skincare products online using the Website and eCommerce apps, providing a seamless digital shopping experience for customers.

ol.li: Configure the website to showcase your brand story, product origins, and beauty philosophy with a clean, attractive layout that builds trust and connects with your audience.
Organize products by categories (e.g., skincare, makeup, body care) to help customers easily find what they need.
Add detailed eCommerce descriptions for each product, on the product form, to explain ingredients, benefits, and how to use them effectively.
Set up payment and delivery options allowing customers to choose between home delivery or in-store pickup, with secure payment gateways for trusted transactions.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Add alternative products to display below the main product on the eCommerce page. For example, if a customer buys shampoo, show the conditioner as a complementary product to encourage a complete routine purchase.

Offer automatic discounts to professional clients who buy in bulk. Go to Sales > Configuration > Pricelists, create one (e.g., ‚ÄúReseller Bulk Pricing‚Äù), and add rules like 10% off for 20+ units. Assign the pricelist to reseller contacts‚Äîdiscounts apply automatically on their sales orders.

template.p: Streamline purchasing of cosmetics and packaging materials to keep your business supplied efficiently.

li.p: Create a Purchase Order in the Purchase app when you need to buy products such as skincare items, makeup, or packaging supplies.
Choose the best vendor by comparing prices, delivery times, and supplier reliability to secure favorable purchasing terms.
Confirm the Purchase Order and send a Request for Quotation (RFQ) via email to suppliers or manually confirm the order when ready.
Upon receiving the shipment, use the Receipt smart button to validate the incoming goods and update your purchase records accordingly.

template.p: Use the Inventory app to track cosmetic products and packaging materials in real-time and maintain optimal stock levels.

ol.li: Open the Inventory app and select the product you want to manage (e.g., facial serum, body lotion).
Monitor stock quantities across different warehouse locations or stores to ensure availability.
Use Smart Buttons on the product page to view stock moves.

Set Reordering Rules by defining minimum and maximum stock levels to automate replenishment. Example: For a solid shampoo, set the minimum stock at 5 units and maximum at 15 units to trigger automatic reordering when stock falls below 5.
When stock drops below the minimum threshold, Odoo automatically generates a Purchase Order based on these rules to avoid stockouts.

div.class: o_editor_banner user-select-none o-contenteditable-false lh-1 d-flex align-items-center alert alert-info pb-0 pt-3

div.p: Add vendor lead times on each product to anticipate delivery delays and plan procurement accordingly (e.g., 7-day lead time for imported skincare products).

ol.li: Sell a facial serum in-store using the Point of Sale (PoS) app, selecting the desired scent or size, and suggest complementary products like a moisturizer.
Showcase your products nicely on your website with detailed descriptions and ingredient info, then handle incoming orders through the Website & eCommerce apps.
Create a Purchase Order in the Purchase app to restock popular items based on sales trends.
Receive the shipment and validate it in the Inventory app to update stock levels automatically.
When stock falls below your set minimum, Odoo automatically triggers reorder based on your reordering rules.
